<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.2 is: Functions shall not call themselves, either directly or indirectly.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of setup_epoll_fd:
```c
static int
setup_epoll_fd (struct MHD_Daemon *daemon)
{
  int fd;

#ifndef HAVE_MESSAGES
  (void) daemon; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#endif /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */

#ifdef USE_EPOLL_CREATE1
  fd = epoll_create1 (EPOLL_CLOEXEC);
#else  /* ! USE_EPOLL_CREATE1 */
  fd = epoll_create (MAX_EVENTS);
#endif /* ! USE_EPOLL_CREATE1 */
  if (MHD_INVALID_SOCKET == fd)
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Call to epoll_create1 failed: %s\n"),
              MHD_socket_last_strerr_ ());
#endif
    return MHD_INVALID_SOCKET;
  }
#if ! defined(USE_EPOLL_CREATE1)
  if (! MHD_socket_noninheritable_ (fd))
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Failed to set noninheritable mode on epoll FD.\n"));
#endif
  }
#endif /* ! USE_EPOLL_CREATE1 */
  return fd;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
fd = epoll_create (MAX_EVENTS);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 17.2 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The function setup_epoll_fd calls the system/library function epoll_create(MAX_EVENTS). epoll_create is an external POSIX/system call and does not call setup_epoll_fd (nor does setup_epoll_fd call itself), so there is no direct or indirect recursion. (Only a violation would occur if epoll_create were unexpectedly implemented to call setup_epoll_fd, which is not the case.)
